item.title: 国债反弹有可能碰上 1,250 亿美元的砖墙
item.description: 债券交易员们对美国劳动力市场降温的首个明确迹象表示欢迎，但这只是他们一年来所期待的真正全面反弹所需的一部分。【原文：Bond traders welcomed their first clear sign of a cooling US labor market, but it’s only a part of what’s needed to fire up the truly sweeping rally they’ve been hoping for all year.】

item.title: 通胀再起波澜，澳大利亚央行将关键利率维持在 12 年高位
item.description: 澳大利亚央行可能会将其关键利率维持在 12 年来的高位，并在今年大部分时间内保持这一水平，以抑制因就业市场出人意料地紧张而带来的通胀压力。【原文：Australia’s central bank will likely keep its key interest rate at a 12-year high and stick with it for much of the year to restrain inflationary pressures underpinned by a surprisingly tight job market.】

item.title: 习近平抵达巴黎，法国加大电动汽车研发力度
item.description: 法国政府将于周一与汽车行业签署一项范围广泛的协议，为电动汽车销售设定新目标，而中国国家主席习近平即将对法国进行国事访问。【原文：The French government will sign a wide-ranging pact with the automotive industry on Monday that sets new targets for electric vehicle sales, just as Chinese President Xi Jinping arrives for a state visit clouded by trade tensions in the sector.】

item.title: 华尔街前往西部参加米尔肯会议，寻求交易复兴
item.description: 电影明星的天堂比佛利山庄正在让位给金融界的名人。【原文：The movie-star haven of Beverly Hills is giving way to the luminaries of finance.】

item.description: 在周六于奥马哈举行的伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway Inc.【原文：At Berkshire Hathaway Inc.’s annual meeting in Omaha on Saturday, Warren Buffett heaped praise on Apple Inc. — after revealing he’d cut his stake in it.】

item.title: 兰博基尼兄弟不再：加密货币正在创造新的财富效应
item.description: 这是社交媒体上屡见不鲜的轶事：那些早期投资加密货币的人享受到了改变人生的财富。【原文：It’s an oft-told anecdote littering social media: Those who invested early in cryptocurrencies have enjoyed life-changing wealth.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯因资本支出攀升而出现预算赤字
item.description: 由于资本支出和其他领域支出的增长超过了收入的增长，沙特阿拉伯连续第六个季度出现预算赤字。【原文：Saudi Arabia recorded a sixth straight quarterly budget deficit as increased spending on capital expenditure and other areas outpaced growth in revenue.】

item.title: 澳大利亚住房租金创历史新高，令澳大利亚央行头疼不已
item.description: 澳大利亚的房屋租赁价值在四月份创下了新的纪录，一些城市的房屋租赁价值出现了新的增长势头，这对储备银行来说是一个令人担忧的信号，储备银行可能会在本周将借贷成本维持在12年来的最高水平，以避免价格压力。【原文：Australia’s housing rental value hit a fresh record in April with some cities seeing renewed growth momentum, a troubling sign for the Reserve Bank that’s likely to leave borrowing costs at a 12-year high this week to stave off price pressures.】

item.title: 对冲基金的期权押注为绿色投资者提供了预测回报的途径
item.description: 如果你想知道你的绿色股票投资组合下个季度的表现如何，你应该看看对冲基金的期权押注。【原文：If you want to know how your green stock portfolio is likely to perform next quarter, you should take a look at hedge funds’ options bets.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯提高所有等级石油对亚洲的销售价格
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯连续第三个月上调其旗舰原油对亚洲的价格，因为沙特试图收紧石油市场以防止全球石油过剩。【原文：Saudi Arabia raised the price of its flagship crude to Asia for a third consecutive month, as the kingdom tries to tighten the oil market to prevent a global surplus.】

item.title: 新兴市场乐观情绪因美联储而破灭，货币和债券下挫
item.description: 四月份新兴市场债券和货币的溃败，让一些曾经的多头对该资产类别的前景变得消极起来。【原文：An April rout in emerging-market bonds and currencies has some former bulls turning negative on the outlook for the asset class.】

item.title: 巴基斯坦最大的电缆制造商计划本月出售股票
item.description: 巴基斯坦 Fast Cables 有限公司正计划利用当地股市涨至历史新高的机会，在本月进行一次全国规模最大的股票上市。【原文：Pakistan’s Fast Cables Ltd. is planning one of the nation’s largest share listings this month, taking advantage of a rally in the local stock market to a record high.】

item.title: 疫苗合作伙伴打响病毒研发第一枪，变身竞争对手
item.description: 欧洲的两个合作伙伴不久将在一个新战场上争夺主导权：保护旅行者免受蚊子传播的一种痛苦的病毒性疾病的疫苗。【原文：Two European partners will soon be vying for dominance in a new battleground: vaccines to protect travelers against a painful viral illness transmitted by mosquitoes.】

item.title: 西方制裁如何扼杀普京的北极天然气野心
item.description: 俄罗斯的堡垒经济在西方制裁的冲击下表现出了惊人的韧性。克里姆林宫入侵乌克兰两年后，俄罗斯仍在继续资助一场代价高昂的战争，并支持总统弗拉基米尔-普京。【原文：Russia’s fortress economy has proved remarkably resilient to an onslaught of Western sanctions. Two years after the Kremlin’s invasion of Ukraine, it continues to fund a costly war and to prop up President Vladimir Putin.】

item.title: 日元暴涨后耶伦建议谨慎干预货币政策
item.description: 美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）承认本周日元币值大幅波动，但她拒绝透露日本是否进行了干预以支持日元。【原文：US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen acknowledged sharp moves in the value of the yen this week, even as she declined to say whether Japan had intervened to support the currency.】

item.title: 芒格去世后，后巴菲特时代的伯克希尔成为奥马哈关注的焦点

Then came the questions: How will it operate without Warren Buffett?】

item.title: 法国总统马克龙呼吁重启与中国的经济关系
item.description: 法国总统埃马纽埃尔-马克龙（Emmanuel Macron）呼吁更新法国与中国的经济关系，正值中国领导人习近平预计前往法国进行国事访问之际。【原文：French President Emmanuel Macron is calling for an update of the country’s economic ties with China, just as the country’s leader Xi Jinping is expected to travel to France for a State visit.】

item.title: 南非政府对稳定债务充满信心
item.description: 南非总统西里尔-拉马福萨（Cyril Ramaphosa）表示，他相信他的政府已经在服务支出与控制国家不断膨胀的债务水平之间找到了平衡点。【原文：South Africa’s President Cyril Ramaphosa says he’s confident that his government has found the balance between spending on services while reining in the nation’s ballooning debt levels.】

item.title: 贝利的降息计划将与鲍威尔的不同
item.description: 英国央行可能会在下周就其是否计划在今年夏天降息发出更明确的信号，而此时投资者正押注于宽松政策的延迟前景。【原文：The Bank of England may offer a clearer signal in the coming week on whether it plans to cut interest rates this summer, just as investors bet on a delayed outlook for easing.】

item.title: ISS 建议波音投资者投票反对 CEO 薪酬方案
item.description: 机构股东服务公司（Institutional Shareholder Services）敦促波音公司（Boeing Co.【原文：Institutional Shareholder Services urged Boeing Co. investors to vote against a $32.8 million pay package for its chief executive officer, citing concerns over a special equity award and a “sizable increase” in his long-term incentive grant.】

item.title: 加密初创企业估值飙升，投资回暖
item.description: 加密初创企业正通过积极的筹资方式让估值驶入快车道，这反映了数字资产行业的复苏，以及风险基金希望把钱用在刀刃上的愿望。【原文：Crypto startups are putting valuations in the fast lane with an aggressive form of fundraising that reflects the digital-asset industry’s recovery as well as a desire among venture funds to put money to work.】

item.description: 美国公司强劲的盈利业绩可能不再足以维持股票涨势。利润前景正变得越来越重要。【原文：Strong earnings beats from Corporate America may no longer be enough to keep the stock rally going. Profit outlooks are becoming more important.】

item.title: 日本儿童人口创历史新低，影响经济增长
item.description: 日本的儿童人数再创历史新低，这清楚地提醒人们，亚洲第二大经济体正面临着严峻的人口挑战。【原文：The number of children in Japan has dropped to another record, in a stark reminder of the demographic challenges that are weighing on Asia’s second biggest economy.】

item.title: 777 合作伙伴的贷款人在诉讼中指控欺诈和双重抵押
item.description: 777 Partners 的贷款人指控该公司欺诈，称这家总部位于迈阿密的投资公司以 3.5 亿美元的资产为抵押借款，而这些资产要么不属于该公司，要么根本不存在。【原文：Lenders to 777 Partners accused it of fraud, claiming that the Miami-based investment firm borrowed against $350 million of assets that either it didn’t own or didn’t exist.】

item.title: 巴菲特将吸引大批观众，但芒格的俏皮话将被错过
item.description: 内布拉斯加州奥马哈（美联社）— 数万名投资者预计将于周六再次来到内布拉斯加州奥马哈市的一个竞技场，聆听亿万富翁沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）的智慧之言。但在伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）的年度股东大会上，将缺少一个关键要素：这是副董事长查理-芒格去世后的首次股东大会。【原文：OMAHA, Neb. (AP) — Tens of thousands of investors are expected to once again descend on an Omaha, Nebraska, arena Saturday to vacuum up tidbits of wisdom from billionaire Warren Buffett. But a key ingredient will be missing from his annual Berkshire Hathaway shareholders’ meeting: It's the first since Vice Chairman Charlie Munger died.】

item.title: 菲律宾央行收紧脏钱风险报告规则
item.description: 菲律宾中央银行将要求金融机构在发现与洗钱和恐怖主义融资有关的风险后 24 小时内提交报告，因为这个东南亚国家正在加大打击非法交易的力度。【原文：The Philippines central bank will require financial institutions to submit a report within 24 hours of discovering risks linked to money laundering and terrorist financing, as the Southeast Asian nation steps up its fight against illicit transactions.】

item.title: 火山爆发后，印度尼西亚转移了 10,000 人
item.description: 印尼北苏拉威西省的一座活火山可能会爆发更多火山爆发，人们担心火山爆发会造成更多损失，因此印尼将永久性迁移约 10,000 名居住在岛上的居民。【原文：Indonesia will permanently relocate some 10,000 people living on an island in North Sulawesi following concerns that more eruptions could come from an active volcano that has already caused damages.】
